                                     '\n'

                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'DuckDB requires\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'CMake\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'to be installed and a\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            C++11\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     'compliant compiler. GCC 4.9 and newer, '
                                     'Clang 3.9 and newer and VisualStudio '
                                     '2017 are tested on each revision.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Run\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            make\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     'in the root directory to compile the '
                                     'sources. For development, use\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            make debug\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     'to build a non-optimized debug version. '
                                     'You may run\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            make unit\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     'and\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            make allunit\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     'to verify that your version works '
                                     'properly after making changes.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'A command line utility based on\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            sqlite3\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     'can be found in either\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            build/release/duckdb_cli\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     '(release, the default) or\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            build/debug/duckdb_cli\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     '(debug).\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'As DuckDB is an embedded database, there '
                                     'is no database server to launch or '
                                     'client to connect to a running server. '
                                     'However, the database server can be '
                                     'embedded directly into an application '
                                     'using the C or C++ bindings. The main '
                                     'build process creates the shared '
                                     'library\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            '
                                     'build/release/src/libduckdb.[so|dylib|dll]\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     'that can be linked against. A static '
                                     'library is built as well.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'For examples on how to embed DuckDB into '
                                     'your application, see the\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'examples\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'folder.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'After compiling, benchmarks can be '
                                     'executed from the root directory by '
                                     'executing\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '            '
                                     './build/release/benchmark/benchmark_runner\n'
                                     '           \n'
                                     '.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'DuckDB is implemented in C++ 11, should '
                                     'compile with GCC and clang, uses CMake '
                                     'to build and\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Catch2\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'for testing. DuckDB uses some components '
                                     'from various Open-Source databases and '
                                     'draws inspiration from scientific '
                                     'publications. Here is an overview:\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Parser: We use the PostgreSQL parser '
                                     'that was\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'repackaged as a stand-alone library\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '. The translation to our own parse tree '
                                     'is inspired by\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Peloton\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Shell: We have adapted the\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'SQLite shell\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'to work with DuckDB.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Tests: We use the\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'SQL Logic Tests from SQLite\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'to test DuckDB.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Query fuzzing: We use\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'SQLsmith\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'to generate random queries for '
                                     'additional testing.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Date Math: We use the date math '
                                     'component from\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'MonetDB\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     "SQL Window Functions: DuckDB's window "
                                     'functions implementation uses Segment '
                                     'Tree Aggregation as described in the '
                                     'paper "Efficient Processing of Window '
                                     'Functions in Analytical SQL Queries" by '
                                     'Viktor Leis, Kan Kundhikanjana, Alfons '
                                     'Kemper and Thomas Neumann.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Execution engine: The vectorized '
                                     'execution engine is inspired by the '
                                     'paper "MonetDB/X100: Hyper-Pipelining '
                                     'Query Execution" by Peter Boncz, Marcin '
                                     'Zukowski and Niels Nes.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     "Optimizer: DuckDB's optimizer draws "
                                     'inspiration from the papers "Dynamic '
                                     'programming strikes back" by Guido '
                                     'Moerkotte and Thomas Neumman as well as '
                                     '"Unnesting Arbitrary Queries" by Thomas '
                                     'Neumann and Alfons Kemper.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Concurrency control: Our MVCC '
                                     'implementation is inspired by the paper '
                                     '"Fast Serializable Multi-Version '
                                     'Concurrency Control for Main-Memory '
                                     'Database Systems" by Thomas Neumann, '
                                     'Tobias Mühlbauer and Alfons Kemper.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Regular Expression: DuckDB uses '
                                     "Google's\n"
                                     '\n'
                                     'RE2\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'regular expression engine.\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     'Continuous Benchmarking (CB™)\n'
                                     '\n'
                                     ', runs TPC-H, TPC-DS and some '
                                     'microbenchmarks on every commit',
                                     'Estimated reading time:Estimate reading '
                                     'time: 2 minutes minutes'),

                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'Link: '
                                                   'https://www.reddit.com/r/hnblogs/\n'
                                                   'Old Reddit Link: '
                                                   'https://old.reddit.com/r/hnblogs/\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'Hi HN,\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'Inspired by this post '
                                                   'earlier this week: '
                                                   'https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23237559, '
                                                   'I thought we could make '
                                                   'blog discovery easier by '
                                                   'having a place to find '
                                                   'interesting, unusual, '
                                                   'niche, or really any kind '
                                                   'of non-marketing blogs '
                                                   'that are posted by the '
                                                   'people that write them.\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'There are a ton of '
                                                   'interesting blogs on the '
                                                   'web, probably more than '
                                                   'there were when the web '
                                                   'was new, but even though '
                                                   "there's more they're a "
                                                   'smaller percentage of the '
                                                   'total internet and hard to '
                                                   'find.\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'Search engines fail to '
                                                   'help with this for a lot '
                                                   "of reasons. They're both\n"
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'not\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'incentivized to find this '
                                                   'kind of non-ad, non-sales '
                                                   'content, and there are '
                                                   'lots of sophisticated '
                                                   'actors trying to game '
                                                   'search engines to show '
                                                   'their own content.\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'Regular people just '
                                                   'writing interesting blogs '
                                                   "who don't have an interest "
                                                   'in SEO will be lost in '
                                                   'that shuffle.\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'HN and Reddit are great '
                                                   'for link aggregations, but '
                                                   'rely on submissions and '
                                                   'upvotes which skew things '
                                                   'to more generally popular '
                                                   'content. The volume of '
                                                   'posts also make it hard to '
                                                   'compete (even though I '
                                                   'really like HN and find '
                                                   'the content interesting).\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'The restriction to only '
                                                   'allow posts from the '
                                                   'authors of the blogs '
                                                   'should help and the writer '
                                                   'can interact with the '
                                                   'community.\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'The end goal is to '
                                                   'generate a wiki on Reddit '
                                                   'reminiscent of old 90s '
                                                   "'portal' pages with "
                                                   'curated links to '
                                                   'interesting content.\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   '\n'
                                                   'We have a small initial '
                                                   'community from my HN '
                                                   'comment on that other post '
                                                   '(https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23239999), '
                                                   'but if you write a blog '
                                                   'and want to join please '
                                                   'do!\n'
