 'https://oyvn.github.io/multi-room-audio-with-snapcast': ('\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Multi-room audio '
                                                           'with Snapcast and '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'raspberrypi\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'snapcast\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'spotify\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'audio\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'tutorial\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snapcast\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'is an open-source '
                                                           'project that '
                                                           'streams audio over '
                                                           'network so it can '
                                                           'be played '
                                                           'synchronously, '
                                                           'like Sonos.\n'
                                                           'I recently set it '
                                                           'up at home with '
                                                           'some Raspberry Pis '
                                                           'to play Spotify '
                                                           'around my '
                                                           'apartment. Here’s '
                                                           'how I did it.\n'
                                                           'I tried to show my '
                                                           'work, so hopefully '
                                                           'people can follow '
                                                           'along (I’m no '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi/Linux '
                                                           'expert myself).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Table of Contents\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           ':\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Software and '
                                                           'hardware overview\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Here are the '
                                                           'software projects '
                                                           'involved:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snapcast\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snapdroid\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- Android app, '
                                                           'available on '
                                                           'Google Play.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snap.Net\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- Windows snapcast '
                                                           'client\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Librespot\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- Spotify client\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'Tools\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- For cross '
                                                           'compiling for '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi Zero '
                                                           'W.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Raspbian\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'balenaEtcher\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- For programming '
                                                           'Raspbian onto the '
                                                           'memory card.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Windows Subsystem '
                                                           'for Linux\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- For Windows '
                                                           'users, to SSH into '
                                                           'the Raspberry Pis, '
                                                           'and to compile '
                                                           'Librespot. It '
                                                           'might be possible '
                                                           'without (using '
                                                           'Putty, and '
                                                           'compiling natively '
                                                           'in Windows), but '
                                                           'the instructions '
                                                           'assume a Linux '
                                                           'environment, and I '
                                                           'did it in WSL.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Spotify\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- For the Spotify '
                                                           'setup to work, you '
                                                           'need a paid '
                                                           'Spotify account. '
                                                           'Snapcast work with '
                                                           'lots of other '
                                                           'audio stream '
                                                           'sources as well '
                                                           '(see the docs).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'And the hardware I '
                                                           'used:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Raspberry Pi Zero '
                                                           'W\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- Get the ‘h’ '
                                                           'variant to avoid '
                                                           'soldering. Any '
                                                           'other Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'will also work. '
                                                           'You need one Pi '
                                                           'for each speaker '
                                                           'setup and one to '
                                                           'serve as an '
                                                           'snapcast server. I '
                                                           'happened to have '
                                                           'an old Raspberry '
                                                           'Pi 1 lying around '
                                                           'that I used as a '
                                                           'server, but using '
                                                           'one of the Zeros '
                                                           'as both a server '
                                                           'and a client '
                                                           'should work OK, I '
                                                           'tried it at one '
                                                           'point with the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi 1.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Micro SD cards for '
                                                           'the Raspberry Pis. '
                                                           'I use 32 GB, but '
                                                           '16 GB should work '
                                                           'as well (8 GB '
                                                           'might give you '
                                                           'trouble).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'HifiBerry DAC+ '
                                                           'Zero\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- DAC (audio) '
                                                           'shield for the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi Zero '
                                                           'since it doesn’t '
                                                           'have build in '
                                                           'audio. You don’t '
                                                           'need a DAC if you '
                                                           'have built in '
                                                           'audio, although it '
                                                           'might give you '
                                                           'slightly better '
                                                           'sound.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Exibel X50\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '- Radio with line '
                                                           'in (3.5 mm jack) '
                                                           'and USB power. But '
                                                           'you can use '
                                                           'anything that can '
                                                           'receive audio.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Audio cables (the '
                                                           'HifiBerry gives '
                                                           'RCA out, so I’m '
                                                           'using an RCA to '
                                                           'jack cable, check '
                                                           'what your speaker '
                                                           'setup needs).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'USB power sources '
                                                           'and cables for the '
                                                           'Pis.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Memory card reader '
                                                           'to program '
                                                           'Raspbian onto the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pis.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Prepare the '
                                                           'software\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snapcast\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snapcast consists '
                                                           'of two different '
                                                           'programs: '
                                                           'snapserver and '
                                                           'snapclient.\n'
                                                           'Both are available '
                                                           'in Raspbian’s '
                                                           'package manager, '
                                                           'but the versions '
                                                           'are outdated '
                                                           '(currently '
                                                           '0.15.0), so we '
                                                           'will instead '
                                                           'download the\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'newest release\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'from Github '
                                                           '(currently '
                                                           '0.19.0).\n'
                                                           'Download the '
                                                           '“_armhf.deb” '
                                                           'variant of both '
                                                           'snapserver and '
                                                           'snapclient.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Librespot\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Librespot '
                                                           'unfortunately '
                                                           'doesn’t have '
                                                           'builds available, '
                                                           'so we need to '
                                                           'compile it '
                                                           'ourselves.\n'
                                                           'Don’t worry '
                                                           'though, I found '
                                                           'this pretty '
                                                           'straightforward to '
                                                           'do.\n'
                                                           'It’s written in '
                                                           'Rust, which has a '
                                                           'very streamlined '
                                                           'build '
                                                           'environment.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'We need to compile '
                                                           'it for the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi, but '
                                                           'we don’t want to '
                                                           'compile it\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'on\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'the Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'because it takes '
                                                           'too long.\n'
                                                           'I tried on my '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi 1 '
                                                           '(comparable to the '
                                                           'Zero), and gave up '
                                                           'after it had been '
                                                           'compiling for 2-3 '
                                                           'hours.\n'
                                                           'This means we need '
                                                           'to “cross '
                                                           'compile”, which '
                                                           'just means we '
                                                           'compile it on a '
                                                           'different '
                                                           'architecture '
                                                           '(regular computer '
                                                           '- x86) than we run '
                                                           'it on (Raspberry '
                                                           'Pi - ARM).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Get the Librespot '
                                                           'source code from '
                                                           'Github (link '
                                                           'above).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'If using the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi Zero '
                                                           'or a Raspberry Pi '
                                                           '1 as the audio '
                                                           'server, you also '
                                                           'need to do the '
                                                           'following (because '
                                                           'those models have '
                                                           'an older version '
                                                           'of ARM):\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Get Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'Tools from Github '
                                                           '(see above).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Edit .cargo/config '
                                                           'as specified\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'here\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '.\n'
                                                           'Remember to edit '
                                                           'the path to the '
                                                           'linker to match '
                                                           'where you placed '
                                                           'the '
                                                           'raspberrypi-tools '
                                                           'repo.\n'
                                                           'Go ahead and '
                                                           'remove the\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '           target '
                                                           '= '
                                                           '"arm-unknown-linux-gnueabihf"\n'
                                                           '          \n'
                                                           'line, it gave me '
                                                           'trouble.\n'
                                                           'We will instead '
                                                           'specify the target '
                                                           'when compiling, '
                                                           'see below.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Follow\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Librespot’s '
                                                           'compiling guide\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '.\n'
                                                           'We will be using '
                                                           'the Pipe backend '
                                                           'which does not '
                                                           'require any '
                                                           '“features”:\n'
                                                           'cargo build '
                                                           '--release '
                                                           '--no-default-features '
                                                           '--target="arm-unknown-linux-gnueabihf"\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'This took about 13 '
                                                           'minutes on my '
                                                           'cheap laptop, and '
                                                           'should give you a '
                                                           'single executable '
                                                           'file called '
                                                           '“librespot” '
                                                           'somewhere inside '
                                                           'the “target” '
                                                           'folder (e.g.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '          '
                                                           'target/arm-unknown-linux-gnueabihf/release\n'
                                                           '         \n'
                                                           ').\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Prepare the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pis\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Download the '
                                                           'latest Raspbian '
                                                           'from the link '
                                                           'above.\n'
                                                           'For this project, '
                                                           'you just need the '
                                                           'simplest one (E.g. '
                                                           'Raspbian Buster '
                                                           'Lite).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Now you need to '
                                                           'flash Raspbian '
                                                           'onto the SD card.\n'
                                                           'The download page '
                                                           'has a link to a '
                                                           'guide for this, '
                                                           'which you can '
                                                           'follow.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'This is how I did '
                                                           'it (though there '
                                                           'looks to be even '
                                                           'simpler methods '
                                                           'available):\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Insert the SD card '
                                                           'into the reader.\n'
                                                           'Download '
                                                           'balenaEtcher from '
                                                           'the link above.\n'
                                                           'Open it and choose '
                                                           'the Raspbian Zip '
                                                           'file you '
                                                           'downloaded and the '
                                                           'SD card to flash, '
                                                           'and start the '
                                                           'process (Click '
                                                           '“Flash!”).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Once the flashing '
                                                           'is complete, you '
                                                           'should be able to '
                                                           'open the SD card '
                                                           'as a drive, '
                                                           'possibly called '
                                                           '“boot”.\n'
                                                           'Before removing '
                                                           'the SD card, open '
                                                           'the “boot” drive '
                                                           'and do the '
                                                           'following to '
                                                           'simplify the setup '
                                                           'process:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Create an empty '
                                                           'file called “ssh” '
                                                           'in the top level.\n'
                                                           'This will cause '
                                                           'SSH to be enabled '
                                                           'on bootup, so we '
                                                           'can access the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'remotely. '
                                                           'Otherwise, you '
                                                           'need to hook up a '
                                                           'screen and '
                                                           'keyboard.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Create a '
                                                           '“wpa_supplicant.conf” '
                                                           'file in the top '
                                                           'level with info '
                                                           'about your Wifi '
                                                           'network, as '
                                                           'described\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Raspberry Pi’s '
                                                           'guide\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '.\n'
                                                           'This will allow '
                                                           'the Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'to connect to Wifi '
                                                           'on its first boot, '
                                                           'which is also '
                                                           'needed for remote '
                                                           'access.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'If you have a '
                                                           'HifiBerry, edit '
                                                           'config.txt as '
                                                           'described in\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'HifiBerry’s guide\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '.\n'
                                                           'This enables the '
                                                           'HifiBerry sound '
                                                           'card.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Note that the '
                                                           '“boot” drive shows '
                                                           'up the\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        /boot/\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'folder on the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi once '
                                                           'it boots up.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Assemble the '
                                                           'hardware\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Plug in the SD '
                                                           'card and mount the '
                                                           'HifiBerry. If your '
                                                           'Zero doesn’t have '
                                                           'headers (the '
                                                           'double row of pins '
                                                           'for mounting the '
                                                           'HifiBerry shield), '
                                                           'you need to solder '
                                                           'them on first, I '
                                                           'used\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'this video\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'to guide me. If '
                                                           'you get the “Zero '
                                                           'Wh” variant it has '
                                                           'the headers '
                                                           'already soldered '
                                                           'on.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Plug in the power '
                                                           'and wait for the '
                                                           'Pi to boot up, '
                                                           'which might take '
                                                           'some extra minutes '
                                                           'the first time.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'You can go ahead '
                                                           'and plug in the '
                                                           'audio cables now '
                                                           'if you want to, '
                                                           'though there’s a '
                                                           'bit more to do '
                                                           'before we have '
                                                           'sound.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Configure the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pis\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Do the following '
                                                           'for each Raspberry '
                                                           'Pi you set up, '
                                                           'both clients and '
                                                           'server.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'The Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'should now have '
                                                           'booted and '
                                                           'connected to the '
                                                           'Wifi network.\n'
                                                           'To continue, we '
                                                           'need the IP '
                                                           'address of the '
                                                           'Raspberry Pi.\n'
                                                           'You could use '
                                                           'something like\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        nmap\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           ', but I had '
                                                           'limited success '
                                                           'with that.\n'
                                                           'Usually, you can '
                                                           'log into your '
                                                           'router and see all '
                                                           'the devices '
                                                           'connected to it.\n'
                                                           'If there are a '
                                                           'lot, look for the '
                                                           'ones called '
                                                           '“raspberrypi” or '
                                                           'something like '
                                                           'that, or diconnect '
                                                           'the Raspberry Pi '
                                                           'and see which '
                                                           'entry disappears.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'When you have the '
                                                           'IP address, SSH '
                                                           'into it:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'ssh pi@<IP '
                                                           'address>\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'For example\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        ssh '
                                                           'pi@10.0.0.5\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           '(\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        pi\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'is the username). '
                                                           'The password '
                                                           'should be '
                                                           '“raspberry”.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'You should now '
                                                           'run\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'raspi-config\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'and set a new '
                                                           'password (for '
                                                           'security, since '
                                                           'SSH is enabled) '
                                                           'and hostname (to '
                                                           'distinguish '
                                                           'different Pis from '
                                                           'each other later, '
                                                           'like when using '
                                                           'Snapcast).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Also, do\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'sudo apt update\n'
                                                           'sudo apt upgrade\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'to get the latest '
                                                           'software updates.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Install Snapcast '
                                                           'and Librespot\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'From earlier, you '
                                                           'should now have '
                                                           'snapserver, '
                                                           'snapclient and '
                                                           'librespot ready.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Exit SSH now if '
                                                           'you haven’t:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'exit\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Clients\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Do the following '
                                                           'for each client '
                                                           'device.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Use\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        scp\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           '(“copy over SSH”) '
                                                           'to copy snapclient '
                                                           '(note the colon '
                                                           'after the IP '
                                                           'address).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'scp <path to '
                                                           'download '
                                                           'folder>/<snapclient '
                                                           'name> pi@<IP '
                                                           'address>:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Note that you can '
                                                           'access the\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        C:\\\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'drive from WSL '
                                                           'via\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        /mnt/c/\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           '.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Now SSH back in '
                                                           'and install the '
                                                           'package.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'sudo apt install '
                                                           './<snapclient '
                                                           'name>\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Now we need to '
                                                           'configure '
                                                           'snapclient a tiny '
                                                           'bit. Modify\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        '
                                                           'SNAPCLIENT_OPTS\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'in\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        '
                                                           '/etc/default/snapclient\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'to add the '
                                                           'HifiBerry as the '
                                                           'sound device:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'SNAPCLIENT_OPTS="-s '
                                                           'sndrpihifiberry"\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'To edit the file '
                                                           'in a terminal, do\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        sudo nano '
                                                           '<filename>\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           '(you need\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        sudo\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'for files in\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        /etc/\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           ').\n'
                                                           'The name '
                                                           '“sndrpihifiberry” '
                                                           'I found by '
                                                           'calling\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        aplay -l\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           ':\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '$ aplay -l\n'
                                                           '**** List of '
                                                           'PLAYBACK Hardware '
                                                           'Devices ****\n'
                                                           'card 0: '
                                                           'sndrpihifiberry '
                                                           '[snd_rpi_hifiberry_dac], '
                                                           'device 0: '
                                                           'HifiBerry DAC HiFi '
                                                           'pcm5102a-hifi-0 '
                                                           '[HifiBerry DAC '
                                                           'HiFi '
                                                           'pcm5102a-hifi-0]\n'
                                                           '  Subdevices: 1/1\n'
                                                           '  Subdevice #0: '
                                                           'subdevice #0\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'If you have some '
                                                           'other setup than '
                                                           'the HifiBerry, '
                                                           'check\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        aplay -l\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'for the name of '
                                                           'the sound card.\n'
                                                           'That’s what I did '
                                                           'to use my\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'MG10XU\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'as one of the '
                                                           'clients.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Restart the client '
                                                           'to read the new '
                                                           'configuration.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'sudo service '
                                                           'snapclient '
                                                           'restart\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Now exit SSH.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Server\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Do the following '
                                                           'for the server '
                                                           'device.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Copy snapserver '
                                                           'and librespot '
                                                           'using\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        scp\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           ':\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'scp <path to '
                                                           'download '
                                                           'folder>/<snapserver '
                                                           'name> pi@<IP '
                                                           'address>:\n'
                                                           'scp <path to '
                                                           'librespot '
                                                           'build>/librespot '
                                                           'pi@<IP address>:\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'SSH back in and '

                                                           '\n'
                                                           'sudo apt install '
                                                           './<snapserver '
                                                           'name>\n'
                                                           'sudo mv librespot '
                                                           '/usr/local/bin/librespot\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'To\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'configure '
                                                           'snapserver to use '
                                                           'librespot\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           ', add a\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        stream\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'entry to\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        '
                                                           '/etc/snapserver.conf\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           '(fill in your '
                                                           'Spotify user name '
                                                           'and password):\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'stream = '
                                                           'librespot:///librespot?name=Spotify&username=<spotify '
                                                           'username>&password=<spotify '
                                                           'password>&devicename=Snapcast&bitrate=320&nomalize=true&autoplay=false\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Also remove any '
                                                           'streams added by '
                                                           'default (just '
                                                           'write a\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '        #\n'
                                                           '       \n'
                                                           'before the line to '
                                                           'remove it).\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Restart the server '
                                                           'to read the new '
                                                           'configuration.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'sudo service '
                                                           'snapserver '
                                                           'restart\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Play music\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'At this point, the '
                                                           'server should show '
                                                           'up as “Snapcast” '
                                                           'in your Spotify '
                                                           'under “Devices '
                                                           'available” (should '
                                                           'be a button '
                                                           'located close to '
                                                           'the play bar when '
                                                           'playing music).\n'
                                                           'If you choose '
                                                           '“Snapcast” and '
                                                           'play a song, you '
                                                           'should hear sound '
                                                           'from all your '
                                                           'clients, et '
                                                           'voilà!\n'
                                                           'There might be a '
                                                           'short delay, and '
                                                           'also a bit of '
                                                           'sputtering as the '
                                                           'sound '
                                                           'synchronizes.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snapdroid\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'I recommend '
                                                           'installing '
                                                           'Snapdroid '
                                                           '(available on '
                                                           'Google Play) to '
                                                           'have better '
                                                           'control and '
                                                           'overview over the '
                                                           'system.\n'
                                                           'It allows you to '
                                                           'see the names of '
                                                           'the available '
                                                           'clients, and to '
                                                           'tweak the '
                                                           'individual names, '
                                                           'volumes and '
                                                           'latencies for each '
                                                           'client.\n'
                                                           'It also allows you '
                                                           'to listen to the '
                                                           'stream.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Snap.Net\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'You can also '
                                                           'install Snap.Net '
                                                           '(get the installer '
                                                           'from releases on '
                                                           'Github) which does '
                                                           'the same as '

                                                           'I use both, '
                                                           'Snapdroid to '
                                                           'control from '
                                                           'anywhere and to '
                                                           'debug issues, '
                                                           'Snap.Net as a '
                                                           'client in my '
                                                           'office.\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           '\n'
                                                           'Enjoy!',
                                                           'Estimated reading '
                                                           'time:Estimate '
                                                           'reading time: 8 '
                                                           'minutes minutes'),
